title: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA: John Barth and Sabbatical: A Love Story
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any agency documents related to the American author John Simmons Barth and his novel "Sabbatical: A Love Story" published in 1982. Barth (born: May 27th, 1980 - died: April 2nd, 2024) published a novel called "Sabbatical: A Love Story" that was inspired by the death of agency employee John Paisley. 

https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2024/04/02/john-barth-author-dead-obituary/

Of particular interest is any agency correspondence (either to or from) the following agency officials that mention John Barth and "Sabbatical: A Love Story" or allude to the book publicizing the John Paisley episode:

William J. Casey 
Bobby Ray Inman
Frank Carlucci
John M. McMahon
Robert Gates

In addition, conduct a search of correspondence (either to or from) an agency public affairs or media representative that discussed John Barth or his writings. Please also conduct a search of any agency collection of news reports regarding John Barth and his writings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
